page.title: 09THE TRANSPORT IN WOODINGDEAN
page.content: There are lots of buses in Woodingdean which go into the main Brighton area.The route numbers are: 2,2a,12,22,29,59 and 59a.Journey time is approximately 2O minutes from the Downs Hotel to Brighton Town Centre.The main linking roads in Woodingdean are the roads to Rottingdean and up to the Lewes Road. Warren Road is the other main road linking Woodingdean with Brighton.The housing estates of Woodingdean all link into these roads,there being no other through routes.In the winter the buses stop at the Downs Hotel because they can't get up the hills.A return to the main shopping centre for an adult is Â£1.OO,and for a child it is 5Op.There are 6 buses an hour into Brighton,plus one other which goes to Sainsburys in Lewes Road.There is no other public transport.
